channel.title: Filter scaling help
channel.description: Hi all, back again, Well I got my first Axoloti, I just have a question I hope someone can help me with, I've started building my first synth on it, and I'd like to know what to use to scale the keyboard for the filter, basically so that it sounds darker in the bass end and brighter in the high end, I've tried everything I can think of, but I must be missing something, can anyone help please. regards Sean

item.title: Filter scaling help
item.dc:creator: @dark_angeluk1 Sean Crighton-Hara
item.description:
@dark_angeluk1 wrote:

Well, I think I've got it.
Thanks for the help chaps
I'm more than willing to share it when its finished to my satisfaction.
once again thanks
'Hours of fun?' think weeks/months lost to working on ideas I'm currently saving up to get a couple more for other ideas I have

Read full topic

item.title: Filter scaling help
item.dc:creator: @Ott
item.description:
@Ott wrote:

Filters use the same tuning/scaling as the oscillators. Just feed whatever you're feeding your oscillator pitch into your filter pitch.

Read full topic

item.title: Filter scaling help
item.dc:creator: @igel s
item.description:
@igel wrote:

Hi Sean,

Is it keyboard tracking you are looking for? Depending on the midi note the cutoff frequency changes. If you search for keyboard tracking cutoff frequency you'll find some posts about it here in this forum.

I remember there's a post here where simply the note output of your keyboard object modulates the inlet (pitch, frequ or cutoff) of your filter, with a bit of simple math in between.

Several modulation signals Patching
Hi, Is it better to add, multiple, or mix several modulation signals? For example I would like to modulate a cut off frequency of vcf using lfo, adsr and keyboard tracking. Which of these ways sound better and loads dsp less?

Good luck. Hope the axoloti gives you plenty of hours of fun!

Read full topic

item.title: Filter scaling help
item.dc:creator: @dark_angeluk1 Sean Crighton-Hara
item.description:

back again,
Well I got my first Axoloti, I just have a question I hope someone can help me with, I've started building my first synth on it, and I'd like to know what to use to scale the keyboard for the filter, basically so that it sounds darker in the bass end and brighter in the high end, I've tried everything I can think of, but I must be missing something, can anyone help please.
regards
Sean
